headline.main: Containment Cap Appears to Cut Oil Flow

docs.snippet: The New York Insurance Department said yesterday that it had approved the creation of an exchange that would allow insurance companies to reduce their exposure to huge losses by swapping blocks of policies in different parts of the country.    If ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Insurance Department said yesterday that it had approved the creation of an exchange that would allow insurance companies to reduce their exposure to huge losses by swapping blocks of policies in different parts of the country. If the exchange, called the Catastrophe Risk Exchange, is accepted by insurance companies it could solve the biggest problem facing many property insurers: how to protect against huge losses that could arise if a severe hurricane or earthquake hit a heavily developed area.

headline.main: New York Lets Insurers Swap Huge Risks

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI) -- The House passed emergency legislation late today to reduce drastically the interest rate on Federal disaster loans, retroactive to July 1, 1971....
docs.abstract: HR, 325-9, passes emergency legis on June 29 to reduce drastically interest rate on Fed disaster loans retroactive to July 1, '71
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 29 (UPI) -- The House passed emergency legislation late today to reduce drastically the interest rate on Federal disaster loans, retroactive to July 1, 1971.

headline.main: House Reduces Loan Rate To Aid Victims of Floods

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) -- Two private organizations contended today that the Federal response to Hurricane Calmille showed that the Government was not prepared to deal adequately with the human consequences of major natural disasters....
docs.abstract: Amer Friends Service Com and Southern Regional Council charge that Fed response to Camille shows Govt is not prepared to deal adequately with human consequences of natural disasters, rept to Pres Nixon criticizing his recognition of Gov's Emergency Council in Mississippi, an all-white group, as agency through which all Fed funds and aid must be coordinated; hold Fed officials took little or no action to combat racial bias in Mississippi's emergency relief and long-term reconstruction programs; rept is also critical of ARC and OEO
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 24 (AP) -- Two private organizations contended today that the Federal response to Hurricane Calmille showed that the Government was not prepared to deal adequately with the human consequences of major natural disasters.

headline.main: STUDY ASSAILS U.S. ON HURRICANE AID; Neglect of Poor and Racial Discrimination Are Found

docs.snippet: PENICHE, Portugal, Oct. 31 -- The bodies of several persons who perished through, the wrecking of the Anchor Line steamer Roumania were burled in the village of Obidos to-day. The chaplain of the British Legation at Lisbon road the services tor th...
docs.lead_paragraph: PENICHE, Portugal, Oct. 31 -- The bodies of several persons who perished through, the wrecking of the Anchor Line steamer Roumania were burled in the village of Obidos to-day. The chaplain of the British Legation at Lisbon road the services tor the dead and offered a prayer beside the graves. Several members of the British Legation attended as mourners.

headline.main: THE ROUMANIA BREAKING UP.; BURIAL OF SOME OF THE VICTIMS -- STORIES BY THE RESCUED SAILORS.

docs.snippet: HONGKONG, Oct. 18 -- The chief officer of the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company's steamer Bokhara, which was lost during a typhoon on Sand Island, between the Island of Formosa and the mainland of China, hat arrived here. He reports...
docs.lead_paragraph: HONGKONG, Oct. 18 -- The chief officer of the Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Company's steamer Bokhara, which was lost during a typhoon on Sand Island, between the Island of Formosa and the mainland of China, hat arrived here. He reports that of the crew 102 are missing, and little, if any doubt is entertained that they were drowned.

headline.main: WRECK OF THE BOKHARA.; NAMES OF SOME OF THE PASSENGERS AND OFFICERS MISSING.

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Sept 28. -- The steamship H.M. Whitney of the Metropolitan Steamship Company was run into and sunk about 7 o'clock this evening just abreast of Gas Buoy No. 9, Boston Harbor, by the Warren Line steamship Ottoman. The Whitney now lies in an...
docs.abstract: H. M. Whitney Sunk by the Ottoman
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Sept 28. -- The steamship H.M. Whitney of the Metropolitan Steamship Company was run into and sunk about 7 o'clock this evening just abreast of Gas Buoy No. 9, Boston Harbor, by the Warren Line steamship Ottoman. The Whitney now lies in an uncomfortable position in midchannel, between East and South Boston, near the Bird Island Flats.

headline.main: SUNK IN BOSTON HARBOR; THE H.M. WHITNEY RUN DOWN BY THE OTTOMAN. THE METROPOLITAN LINER SENT TO THE BOTTOM BY THE COLLISION -- SIGNALS OF THE WHITNEY WERE DISREGARDED BY THE ENGLISH STEAMER -- OFFICERS AND CREW SAVED.

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Oct. 14 -- The Post has particulars which leave but little doubt of the total loss of the Boston ship Magellan, with her entire complement of officers and seamen, together with a valuable cargo. The owners of the Magellan, Messrs. Hemenway...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Oct. 14 -- The Post has particulars which leave but little doubt of the total loss of the Boston ship Magellan, with her entire complement of officers and seamen, together with a valuable cargo. The owners of the Magellan, Messrs. Hemenway Browne, whose offices are in the New-York Life Insurance Building, on Milk Street, received letters from their agents at Valparaiso to-day, giving full details of the disaster.

headline.main: THE SHIP MAGELLAN LOST; AND THE OFFICERS AND CREW HAVE UNDOUBTEDLY PERISHED.
